intro: Ardisia vestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf ardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for various birds and animals. Ardisia vestita typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded forest environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens and landscapes in warmer climates.
